description: From Middle English garter, from Old Northern French gartier, from Old French garet (compare Old French jartier, from jaret), from Gaulish *garrā, from Proto-Celtic *garros (“calf, shank”) (compare Cornish gar, Cornish gar,Middle Welsh garr, Old Irish gairr). Cognate with French jarretière.

entries.meaning: A band worn around the leg to hold up a sock or stocking.

verbs.description: garter (third-person singular simple present garters, present participle gartering, simple past and past participle gartered)
